title: GLENN GOULD ON TELEVISION - THE COMPLETE CBC BROADCASTS 1954-197
description:
This is part 4 of an ongoing project to complete the total conversion of this set of DVDs to XviD/AVI format. The reason being that this conversion is particularly difficult to do effectively (on a case-by-case basis), so I think it best to have this done by someone who's had some luck in this endeavor (myself) rather than forcing the rest of the world to have to (painfully) go through the hundreds of failed experiments (per DVD) independently! So ...
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

For this encoding (each one will be slightly different) bottom fields were discarded and the video was resized using the Lanzcoz3 method in two successive steps following cropping of top and bottom boundaries and a partial cropping of the sides (I have found that a better result is obtained if some of the side boundaries are retained).

The first step resized the video to 480p while maintaining the aspect ratio of the inner image (not the frame) and then once again to 720p at fixed AR.

Hence the aspect ratio of the internal image is precisely 4:3 even though the video frame itself has an AR of about 1.44444.

After completing the (very speedy) conversion to XviD (bitrates being taken from first-pass results), the 15 minute pieces were combined using "direct stream copy" and ONLY then was the PCM audio converted to AC-3. This conversion was done using avidemux's LAV AC-3 encoder with a bitrate of 448 kbps and sampling frequency 48.0 KHz. As well, the Dolby Pro Logic II algorithm was employed during the audio conversion. 

Nothing else was applied.

So, in effect, this is a "partial demux" of the original .VOB sequence (ie. with the odd fields being interpolated from the evens) and effectively a near-lossless reproduction of the original content in the form of a progressive AVI scan at 720p.
